---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [a6b96fe88c](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/23070/commits/a6b96fe88cd9057b3d8ae9ff118e2ad510335b07)

Import changes exceeding 2%

| %      | File |
| -      | -    |
| +4.68% | `Mathlib.Probability.Independence.Basic` |
| +4.82% | `Mathlib.Probability.Independence.Kernel` |

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Probability.Kernel.Composition.MeasureCompProd | 2093 | 1512 | -581 (-27.76%) |
| Mathlib.Probability.Kernel.Composition.MeasureComp | 2097 | 1517 | -580 (-27.66%) |
| Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Decomposition.Lebesgue | 1982 | 1503 | -479 (-24.17%) |
| Mathlib.Probability.Independence.Kernel | 1451 | 1521 | +70 (+4.82%) |
| Mathlib.Probability.Independence.Basic | 1454 | 1522 | +68 (+4.68%) |
| Mathlib.Probability.Integration | 2042 | 2056 | +14 (+0.69%) |
| Mathlib.InformationTheory.KullbackLeibler.KLFun | 2136 | 2147 | +11 (+0.51%) |
| Mathlib.Probability.Kernel.Composition.IntegralCompProd | 2087 | 2097 | +10 (+0.48%) |
| Mathlib.Probability.StrongLaw | 2118 | 2127 | +9 (+0.42%) |
| Mathlib.Probability.Kernel.Disintegration.Integral | 2154 | 2158 | +4 (+0.19%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Probability.Kernel.Composition.MeasureCompProd` `Mathlib.Probability.Kernel.Disintegration.Basic`|-581|
| `Mathlib.Probability.Kernel.Composition.Lemmas` `Mathlib.Probability.Kernel.Composition.MeasureComp`|-580|
| `Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Decomposition.Lebesgue`|-479|
| `Mathlib.Probability.Kernel.CompProdEqIff` `Mathlib.Probability.Kernel.Composition.AbsolutelyContinuous`|-34|
| `Mathlib.Probability.Kernel.Disintegration.StandardBorel`|-32|
| `Mathlib.Probability.Kernel.Posterior`|-31|
|<details><summary>3 files</summary> `Mathlib.Probability.Kernel.CondDistrib` `Mathlib.Probability.Kernel.Disintegration.Integral` `Mathlib.Probability.Kernel.Disintegration.Unique`</details>|4|
|<details><summary>13 files</summary> `Mathlib.Probability.BorelCantelli` `Mathlib.Probability.CondVar` `Mathlib.Probability.ConditionalExpectation` `Mathlib.Probability.Density` `Mathlib.Probability.Distributions.Gaussian` `Mathlib.Probability.Distributions.Uniform` `Mathlib.Probability.IdentDistrib` `Mathlib.Probability.Moments.Basic` `Mathlib.Probability.Moments.ComplexMGF` `Mathlib.Probability.Moments.MGFAnalytic` `Mathlib.Probability.Moments.Tilted` `Mathlib.Probability.StrongLaw` `Mathlib.Probability.Variance`</details>|9|
| `Mathlib.Probability.Kernel.Composition.IntegralCompProd`|10|
| `Mathlib.InformationTheory.KullbackLeibler.KLFun`|11|
| `Mathlib.Probability.Independence.Integrable` `Mathlib.Probability.Integration`|14|
| `Mathlib.Probability.Independence.Basic`|68|
| `Mathlib.Probability.Independence.Kernel`|70|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IndepFun.comp₀`
`+ IndepFun.congr`
`+ IndepFun.congr'`
`+ Measure.integrable_toReal_rnDeriv`
`+ aemeasurable`
`+ congr`
`+ iIndepFun.comp₀`
`+ iIndepFun.congr`
`+ iIndepFun.congr'`
`+ iIndepFun.indepFun_div_div₀`
`+ iIndepFun.indepFun_div_left₀`
`+ iIndepFun.indepFun_div_right₀`
`+ iIndepFun.indepFun_finset_prod_of_not_mem₀`
`+ iIndepFun.indepFun_finset₀`
`+ iIndepFun.indepFun_prod_range_succ₀`
`++ iIndepFun.indepFun_mul_left₀`
`++ iIndepFun.indepFun_mul_mul₀`
`++ iIndepFun.indepFun_mul_right₀`
`++-- IndepFun.ae_eq`
`- integrable_toReal_rnDeriv`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Thanks for doing this!
I was thinking that we could perhaps weaken the measurability assumption at the `Kernel.IndepFun` level, by using `AEMeasurable f (κ ∘ₘ μ)` (which implies in particular that `μ`-a.e., we have `κ .`-a.e. equality to the measurable function).
But I did not do anything in that direction yet. That's just the way I wanted to try it.

> I was thinking that we could perhaps weaken the measurability assumption at the `Kernel.IndepFun` level, by using `AEMeasurable f (κ ∘ₘ μ)` (which implies in particular that `μ`-a.e., we have `κ .`-a.e. equality to the measurable function).

That's what I had in mind too.
Don't hesitate to push to the branch!

There is an issue with the kernel generalization: to get the necessary `Measure.ae_ae_of_ae_comp` we have to import Kernel.Composition.MeasureComp, which imports Bochner integrals, and those are not allowed to be imported in Independence.Basic.
I removed the `assert_not_exists` for now but that's not the right solution. We'll need to cut some files to separate Bochner integrals first.

Apart from that, it seems to go well. I did not generalize all results but I pushed a few lemmas.

I've reorganized a little bit the imports to make sure that the Bochner integral is not imported in the basic independence file. It has to import basic facts on the composition of kernels, so its imports still get bigger, but more reasonably so.
Thanks for this! I left a few suggestions.
Thanks for this! I left a few suggestions.

You don't need the `simp only` here.
```suggestion
    simp +contextual [hω]
```
Small detail but you can swap `f` and `g` here to drop `symm` on the last line.
You removed this lemma, accidentally I guess.

You can simplify this using the already existing version `Kernel.HasSubgaussianMGF`, something along those lines:
```suggestion
  rw [HasSubgaussianMGF_iff_kernel] at h ⊢
  apply h.congr
  simpa
```

A bit of dot notation:
```suggestion
    · exact (h_indep.precomp Subtype.val_injective).congr (fun i ↦ (A i).ae_eq_mk)
    · exact fun i ↦ (A i).measurable_mk
```

This also works, as you prefer.
```suggestion
  nth_rw 2 [← Finset.sum_coe_sort]
```

pullRequest.title: feat: remove measurable assumptions in Azuma-Hoeffding inequality

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Probability): Azuma-Hoeffding inequality for sub-Gaussian random variables

nodes.body:
Thanks for doing this!
I was thinking that we could perhaps weaken the measurability assumption at the `Kernel.IndepFun` level, by using `AEMeasurable f (κ ∘ₘ μ)` (which implies in particular that `μ`-a.e., we have `κ .`-a.e. equality to the measurable function).
But I did not do anything in that direction yet. That's just the way I wanted to try it.

> I was thinking that we could perhaps weaken the measurability assumption at the `Kernel.IndepFun` level, by using `AEMeasurable f (κ ∘ₘ μ)` (which implies in particular that `μ`-a.e., we have `κ .`-a.e. equality to the measurable function).

That's what I had in mind too.
Don't hesitate to push to the branch!
Thanks for this! I left a few suggestions.

There is an issue with the kernel generalization: to get the necessary `Measure.ae_ae_of_ae_comp` we have to import Kernel.Composition.MeasureComp, which imports Bochner integrals, and those are not allowed to be imported in Independence.Basic.
I removed the `assert_not_exists` for now but that's not the right solution. We'll need to cut some files to separate Bochner integrals first.

Apart from that, it seems to go well. I did not generalize all results but I pushed a few lemmas.

I've reorganized a little bit the imports to make sure that the Bochner integral is not imported in the basic independence file. It has to import basic facts on the composition of kernels, so its imports still get bigger, but more reasonably so.
